intro: Sideritis provincialis, commonly known as the Provincial Sideritis, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
